intro: Cyrtandra eriophylla, commonly known as the small-leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra eriophylla is considered a rare and endangered species.
